text: Willard John Ikola (July 28, 1932 â€“ January 20, 2025) was a Finnish American ice hockey player. He also was a high school boys' hockey coach. He was born in Eveleth, Minnesota. and producing six members of US Olympic hockey teams He played in the 1956 Winter Olympics, where he won a silver medal. Ikola died on January 20, 2025, at the age of 92. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Finnish ice hockey goaltenders Category:American ice hockey goaltenders Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States Category:Sportspeople from Minnesota
title: Willard Ikola
